Identification.BriefDescription: an official programme giving details of the celebrations in Bexhill for the Coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth in 1937; includes photographs; beginning with Divine Service at St.Peter's Church at 11.15a.m. on 9th May, the celebrations included a relay from the De La Warr Pavilion of the broadcast of the Coronaton ceremony on 12th May, the Royal Salute being fired from the old Pavilion site at the foot of Sea Road at 12 noon; at 10.30 on Thursday and Friday, 13th and 14th May, a film of the Coronation ceremony was to be shown at the Playhouse, Western Road; on Saturday 15th there were to be bowls competitions and a sports meeting, a Fanciers' show for poultry, pigeons, rabbits and children's pets, and variety entertainment by Bexhill Amateur Theatrical Society (B.A.T.S.); on Monday 17th at the Polegrove the Bexhill Horse Show was to take place and an Interclub Regatta had been arranged by Bexhill Rowing Club; a Carnival Dance was to follow at 8.30p.m. at the De La Warr Pavilion; the brochure features several photographs, including portaits of the king and queen, and images of their two visits to Bexhill in the past, with accompanying commentary; a visit by Queen Mary in 1935 is also described; the mayor of Bexhill was W.N.Cuthbert and the Town Clerk, S.J.Taylor
Identification.Title: "Bexhill-on-Sea Coronation 1937 Souvenir Programme"

Description.SummaryText: whole: 8 printed pages in a slightly larger, stiff paper cover; design on front; includes several printed photographs; each page has red, white and blue lined border around text
Description.Condition: fair; cover marked and soiled

Event.EventName: Coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet without a cover giving details of stalls, stallholders and activities for the (Bexhill) hospital fair which took place on 10th May 1934, followed by a dance; also included is a calendar, January to November, with a quotation for each day headed by the name and address of the contributor; a winner was to be selected during the fair; many interesting names are recorded, including Countess De La Warr, Miss Sainsbury, Jethro Arscott and Dr.Thorne; also a good selection of illustrated local trade advertisements; one of 5000 printed, certified by the printer on page 11; a model of the Nurses' home was to be on show and bricks bought by children presented, organised by Miss Wilson of Winceby House School

Identification.BriefDescription: a report produced by consultants for the Entertainments Committee of Bexhill Borough Council in September 1944 describing war damage, work needed on dilapidation of the building, and suggestions for improvements and additions; consultants were Johannes Schreiner, architect, Cyril Helsby, engineer, and Ernest Spriggs, surveyor; the initial summary of the report is written by Mr.Helsby; half of the report details the damage and work needed with plans of the building showing the location of war damage; the latter half of the report consists of text, drawings and plans giving ideas for improvements and the new building of a dance hall to the east
Identification.Title: "De La Warr Pavilion - Report on War Damage and Dilapidation and Suggestions for Improvements and Additions for the Entertainments Committee of the Borough of Bexhill"

Description.Condition: fair; cover soiled and discoloured at one side edge; binding beginning to wear especially at bottom of spine; corners softened and worn

Identification.BriefDescription: a report prepared by the Entertainments Management sub-committee of the Bexhill Borough Council issued 21st December 1949; prepared for a meeting of the committee on 5th January 1950, the report deals with catering and entertaining, discussing the current provision at the De La Warr Pavilion, the Colonnade, Egerton Park Pavilion and the possibility of refreshment facilities on the Parades, transport and finance; a programme for the use of the De La Warr Pavilion is suggested, with possible contract for repertory and a summer show; retention of the Egerton Park Pavilion was dependent on various issues; provision of music and its finance end the report, apart from a summary of conclusions and recommendations
Identification.Title: "First Report of Entertainment Management Sub-Committee as to Catering and Entertainments Generally"

Description.Aspect: whole : 20 typed pages stapled into green paper cover
Description.Condition: fair; staples rusting

Identification.BriefDescription: a series of reports on post-war reconstruction prepared for Bexhill Borough Council by 'Group 2' issued with foreword and summary by W.H.Hughes, Mayor, on 15th September 1943; covers reports on the De La Warr Pavilion, the Colonnade and Egerton Park Pavilion; parks and open spaces, highways, sewerage, reinstatement of air raid shelter sites and street lighting; restoration of educational facilities including salaries of staff; restoration of borough electrical and gas services at the end of hostilities; restoration of the administration department of the council with provision of necessary accommodation [please see note below]
Identification.Title: "Borough of Bexhill Borough Development Report of Group No.2"

Identification.BriefDescription: schedule for use at the sale by auction at 6.30p.m. on 3rd March 1905 at the Devonshire Hotel by Messrs.Woodhmas, Son and Parks, with Mr.C.Truscott Beale; lot 1 - land on Bexhill sea front laid out as lawns and promenade from the western boundary of the DLW estate [end of Sea Road] to the end of Devonshire Road; lot 2 - land fronting Hastings Road and proposed tramway for about 160 feet with return frontage of 135 feet to De La Warr Road, total acreage 0r.1r.22p.; if not sold in one lot the land would be offered in three lots; an advantage of the land was that it was the site reserved for licensed premises on the Glyne Estate; refers to an Estate Map not included in this item; a paper strip attached to the front of the schedule states that the sale was to be postponed until 17th March at 6.30p.m.; both sales unless previously sold privately
Identification.Title: "Particulars and Conditions of Sale of Land on the Sea Front and of a Valuable

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet issued for the use of spectators at a Pageant of Bexhill History presented on 12th November 1952 by Bexhill drama groups at De la Warr Pavilion; produced by Christine Portch; narrator Alan Arscott; part of the Bexhill Charter Jubilee celebrations; 11 scenes ranging from the first, '1828 - the Smuggling Incident' and second, '1888 - The Lighting of Bexhill Streets by Gas' featuring well known Bexhill names of the time, to the tenth, '1939 - War-Time Incidents', and 'eleventh, 'The Regatta'; narrator was Alan Arscott; Bexhill entertainments manager was Arthur W.Allcock
Identification.Title: "A Pageant of British History 1828 to 1952"

a booklet giving the Order of Proceedings for the Special Council meeting held on 2nd April 1952 at the De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill-on-Sea as part of the Charter Jubilee celebrations; included in the booklet are lists of council members in 1902 and for 1951 to 1952, of Mayors of the Borough from 1902 to 1952, and of Honorary Freemen; part of the Special Meeting was the presentation of the Freedom of the Borough to Mrs.C.I.Meads, Mr.E.W.C.Bowrey and Mr.R.C.Sewell, whose portrait photographs are featured in the booklet; guests of honour were the Lord Lieutenant of Sussex and his wife, the Duke and Duchess of Norfolk; the Mayor at the time was Mr.G.H.Goodwin; other contents are details of the agenda and of the order of arrival and departure of guests, and an introduction dealing with the Charter of 1902 and the town's development
Identification.Title: "Charter Jubilee Celebrations"

Identification.BriefDescription: a brochure numbered 818 giving details of a 1960 Community Activity Exhibition and associated entertainment which took place at the De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill on 5th, 6th and 7th October 1960 celebrating the building's Silver Jubilee; the centre pages feature a plan of the hall showing the sites of stalls of exhibitors; individual paragraphs give the aims and objectives of exhibitors from page 4 onwards; entertainment ranged from P.T.displays to choral and orchestral concerts and a performance of Gilbert and Sullivan's 'Trial by Jury'; included in the brochure are messages from A.E.Gardner, Chairman of the Organising Committee, and R.F.Botting, Mayor of Bexhill; front cover features an aerial photograph of the Colonnade and the surrounding area; editor of the brochure was E.J.Burnam of Southlands Court, Hastings Road
Identification.Title: "Community Activity Exhibition"

Description.Aspect: whole : 8 pages of printed text on both sides in a card cover; front has dark blue printed title on a background of a light blue full page photograph in a white border; each booklet is individually numbered
Description.Condition: fair

Identification.BriefDescription: a newspaper cutting from the Bexhill Observer of Saturday 9th March 1946 describing the Victory reunion dinner organised by the Bexhill Corporation Gas Department at the De La Warr Pavilion restaurant on the previous Monday; speeches emphasised the good work done by those who remained behind during the war in keeping the works functioning and joining in the town's Civil Defence forces; those who had rejoined them from the forces were congratulated on their return; those on duty at the Ashdown works during the dinner were remembered; presiding at the dinner was Councillor Bliault, chairman of the Fuel and Power Committee; responding to the toast to the department was Mr.L.G.Humphrys, Engineer and Manager at the works; several other names are mentioned

Description.Aspect: whole : 4 columns of newsprint with reproduced photograph from front page of newpaper
Description.Condition: fair; discoloured

Identification.BriefDescription: a programme for a Coronation Rally at the De La Warr Pavilion on 3rd July 1937 organised by Bexhill Boy Scout and Girl Guide associations; includes names of officials of the local associations, the programme of events for the day, and the text of a pageant, 'The Torch of Service' written by Frances H.Burrows; the latter was performed at 2.45p.m. and 8.15p.m.; other activities were stalls and demonstrations by the scouts and guides and Physical Agility displays; the cover features a photograph of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth in scout and guide uniforms, above a message from them and their printed signatures
Identification.Title: "Bexhill Boy Scout and Girl Guide Coronation Rally"

Description.Aspect: whole : 4 printed pages in a white cover with a dark blue and gold border, sepia photograph, emblem of a crown and text, including printed signatures
Description.Condition: fair; some rust stains at stapling

Event.EventName: Bexhill Boy Scout and Girl Guide Rally

Identification.Title: Bexhill Boy Scout and Girl Guide Coronation Rally.

Classification.Keyword: programme, De La Warr Pavilion scout/guide coronation rally 1937

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & hospital fair & detail,1934

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet with details of stalls, stallholders and activities for the hospital fair which took place from 8th to 10th May 1934, followed by a dance; also included is a calendar, January to November, with a quotation for each day headed by the name and address of the contributor; a winner was to be selected during the fair; many interesting names are recorded, including Countess De La Warr, Miss Sainsbury, Jethro Arscott and Dr.Thorne; also a good selection of illustrated local trade advertisements; one of 5000 printed, certified by the printer on page 11; a model of the Nurses' home was to be on show and bricks bought by children presented, organised by Miss Wilson of Winceby House School
Identification.Title: "Souvenir Handbook Bexhill Hospital Fair"

Description.Aspect: whole : 108 printed pages in brown textured cover; front features a coloured drawing pasted on above darker brown printed text; illustrations as part of advertisements inside
Description.Condition: poor; staples missing and pages separate from cover and each other

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 1987.44 a similar booklet without cover and other outside pages

Classification.Keyword: British Newspaper & The Country Journal or The Craftsman & 19.3.1797 & Lord De La Warr appointed Captain of the Yeoman of the Guard

Identification.Title: The Country Journal or the Craftsman

Place.Street: Upper End of Bow Street, Covent Garden

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet giving the Order of Service for the inauguration of the 1200th Charter Year Celebrations at St.Peters Church, Bexhill on Sunday 9th April 1972; attending were Princess Alexandra, as Guest of Honour, the Duke of Norfolk, the Earl De La Warr and other dignitaries; also included in the booklet are details of the arrival of guests and the later unveiling by the Princess of an ironwork panel at the Old Manor House site before her departure at 5.30p.m.; on the last page is the programme for an evening concert by the BBC Concert Orchestra at the De La Warr Pavilion organised by Bexhill Corporation in association with the B.B.C.; Part 1 of the concert was broadcast on Radio 2; conductor was Ashley Lawrence; soloists were Cynthia Glover, soprano, and Rowland Jones, tenor; mayor of Bexhill at the time was Alderman W.G.Sansom

Description.Aspect: whole : 8 printed pages inside a glossy card cover; reproduced photograph and blue, red and white emblem on front; 3 reproduced portrait photographs with text inside
Description.Condition: good

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet giving the Order of Proceedings for the Special Council meeting held on 2nd April 1952 at the De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill-on-Sea as part of the Charter Jubilee Celebrations; included in the booklet are lists of council members in 1902 and for 1951 to 1952, of Mayors of the Borough from 1902 to 1952, and of Honorary Freemen; part of the Special Meeting was the presentation of the Freedom of the Borough to Mrs.C.I.Meads, Mr.E.W.C.Bowrey and Mr.R.C.Sewell, whose portrait photographs are featured in the booklet; guests of honour were the Lord Lieutenant of Sussex and his wife, the Duke and Duchess of Norfolk; the Mayor at the time was Mr.G.H.Goodwin; other contents are details of the agenda and of the order of arrival and departure of guests, and an introduction dealing with the Charter of 1902 and the town's development
Identification.Title: "Charter Jubilee Celebrations"

Description.Aspect: whole : 6 pages of textured paper inside stiff textured card cover; bound with blue cord stitching; printed text and photographs on inside pages; small embossed coat of arms and title details on front cover
Description.Condition: fair; discoloured cover

Event.EventName: Freedom of Borough Special Council Meeting

Identification.BriefDescription: a dyeline print of an architectural drawing of December 1934 produced by Mendelsohn and Chermayeff (E856/11-1) for the construction of the Entertainments Hall, Bexhill, later the De La Warr Pavilion; details electrical services for the auditorium and stage lighting; plans of basement, ground, first and second floors with cross and longitudinal sections through auditorium; includes detailed description of electrical outputs and a schedule of circuits controlled from switchboard; does not appear to have been used in construction

Description.Aspect: 1 large sheet of strong paper made up from two sheets pasted together vertically whole architectural drawings and detail in grid format all on one side
Description.Condition: good; stain on reverse where pasted

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 2006.81.13 another dyeline print of DLWP drawings of June 1935 for electrical services

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & DLWarr & return & prog.,1900

Identification.BriefDescription: an official programme for Earl De La Warr's Reception at Bexhill after the South African Campaign on 25th July 1900; organised by a Welcoming Committee, chairman Councillor Daniel Mayer; the event began at noon with the arrival of guests followed by luncheon at 1p.m. at the Hotel Metropole; music was to be played in Station Square before the arrival of the train from St.Leonards with the Earl and Countess De La Warr; a 15 gun salute was to be fired before the official civic welcome; a procession listed in the booklet proceeded to the Town Hall; from there around the new town streets before returning via Belle Hill and High Street to the Manor House Grounds where the schoolchildren of the town were to be given tea; the cover has two embossed stampings of 'Brisley, Bexhill' and G.Brisley's signature
Identification.Title: "Earl De La Warr's Reception at Bexhill"

Description.Aspect: 10 pages in a buff coloured cover whole cover design and interior text and pictures all printed in sepia
Description.Condition: good; staples slightly rusting

Event.EventName: Return of Earl De La Warr from Boer War

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & station, police & siting,1901

Identification.BriefDescription: a poster published for immediate distribution in Bexhill publicising a telegram sent at 11.32a.m. by Mr.F.Merrifield, Clerk to East Sussex County Council, and received at 12.16p.m. by Earl De La Warr; the Earl had formally objected to a statement of Mr.Henry Young at a recent council meeting about the siting of the new police station, that it could have been sited better on land in Station Road; the telegram from Mr.Merrifield explains that the committee found that the high asking price, and unwaivable building restrictions for the only suitable land available, caused negotiations to fall through; after the decision was made the Earl's offer of land had relieved the committee of the difficulty of acquiring a site; the whole is a message to the Bexhill people from Lord De La Warr in defence of his strong protest at Mr.Young's statement

Object.Notes: previously noted as 'Brook Collection' but not verified

Identification.BriefDescription: a printed letter dated 8th February 1908 from James M.Glover giving details of his new management of the Kursaal, Bexhill, for which he has taken a 'lengthy lease', having managed the entertainment for the previous five years; Mr.Glover mentions the engagement of Herr Wurm's Viennese White Band for Easter week and nine weeks from 22nd July, and proposes to have 500 guinea subscribers to enable the band to play permanently; other performers would be engaged including Fragson, Mr.and Mrs.Arthur Bourchier (Miss Violet Vanbrugh), and Kubelik, the violinist; Fullers Ltd. were to continue to provide refreshments; a form enclosed with the letter was to be forwarded to Mr.Glover; £1 1s for Band Ticket ad reading room etc.; £3 3s for Family Ticket admitting four members

Description.Aspect: 2 printed sheets joined by a pasted strip along vertical edges on reverse and folded whole some printing bolder than the rest
Description.Condition: fair; both sheets pierced for storage

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 1996.535=537; 1996.558 issues of James Glover's 'Bexhill Gazette' 1908; photograph of James Glover and his band 1908

Object.Notes: in 1908 the 8th Earl De La Warr sold the Kursaal to Mr.Claude Johnson, Mr.Garnet Rolt as Manager; Mr.Glover resumed his position as manager and lessee in the same year

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & election & Dunn & letter,1898

Identification.BriefDescription: a printed letter dated 28th February 1898 from the 8th Earl De La Warr presenting his compliments to those living on his estate and others who approved of his promoting Bexhill-on-Sea, recommending H.L.M.Dunn, a candidate for the County Council election, in place of Dr.F.M.Wallis, retired; Mr.Dunn had served the District Council well and would support measures to benefit the district; the heading includes and embossed coat of arms

Description.Aspect: whole : 1 sheet with green embossed heading of coat, of arms and address, and black printed script on one side only
Description.Condition: fair; 20mm vertical tear into centre of top edge at fold; some markingwith edge and small stain

Identification.BriefDescription: a small card issued on behalf of the Earl De La Warr and advising his voters of the time and place of the Bexhill Urban District Council election in which he was to be a candidate; the election was to take place at the Boys' School, Holliers Hill on Monday 5th April 1897 from 8a.m. to 8 p.m.; on the reverse is an imitation voting paper with the name of 'Sackville' in capital letters, followed by 'Earl De La Warr' in brackets, and a cross beside it; the voter's name was inserted as George Brisley and his number as 223; each of the other nine candidates is identified by their occupation, presumably by Mr.Brisley - Allen, jeweller; Batten, wine merchant; Duke, farmer; Greed, builder; Miller, dentist; Povey, butcher retired; Price, labourer?; Thomas, builder; Tickner, grocer; Vidler, labourer; and lastly, Webb, 'The Pioneer'

Description.Aspect: a buff coloured card with printed detail in various sizes on both sides whole annotations in pencil on one side
Description.Condition: fair; one lower corner separate

Identification.BriefDescription: a leaflet issued by Bexhill Progressive Association after 1896 giving detail of officials and rules; president was Earl De La Warr; vice presidents, Dr.J.P.Wills and Mr.J.B.Atchison; treasurer, S.Poulton; secretary, Frank Esam of Devonshire House, Station Road; 13 members of the committee are named; general meetings were held monthly; subscriptions were 5s per year; meetings should end by 10.30p.m.; members were to be proposed and seconded by members; members could introduce a visitor at monthly meeting without his right to vote; the above were some of the 19 rules listed [please see note below]
Identification.Title: "Bexhill Progressive Association"

Description.SummaryText: whole: 1 folded sheet with printed detail on three sides

Identification.BriefDescription: 4 copies of a better quality booklet giving the Order of Proceedings for the Special Council meeting held on 2nd April 1952 at the De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill-on-Sea as part of the Charter Jubilee celebrations; included in the booklet are lists of council members in 1902 and for 1951 to 1952, of Mayors of the Borough from 1902 to 1952, and of Honorary Freemen; part of the Special Meeting was the presentation of the Freedom of the Borough to Mrs.C.I.Meads, Mr.E.W.C.Bowrey and Mr.R.C.Sewell, whose portrait photographs are featured in the booklet; guests of honour were the Lord Lieutenant of Sussex and his wife, the Duke and Duchess of Norfolk; the Mayor at the time was Mr.G.H.Goodwin; other contents are details of the agenda and of the order of arrival and departure of guests, and an introduction dealing with the Charter of 1902 and the town's development
Identification.Title: "Charter Jubilee Celebrations"

Identification.BriefDescription: 5 booklets issued for the Bexhill Flower Shows of 1891 to 1894, and of 1897; the covers feature a similar printed floral design on back and front, the one for 1897 being black printed on red; the content in each is similar to that of the others, being details of executive committee members, class and prize list and rules; the only difference is the gradual change in those organising the show and the venues; by 1897 (.8) the show was held in the grounds of the Manor House, and the President was Earl de La Warr; the executive committee was smaller and some of the previous members were vice-presidents headed by Lord Brassey and Sir Edward Malet, K.C.B.; some have the name G.Brisley handwritten on the cover
Identification.Title: "Bexhill Flower Show"

Description.Aspect: whole : 5 booklets with covers of different colours but simnilar design; 3 booklets have an inserted printed sheet; (.4) to (.7) 8 printed pages; (.8) 4 printed pages
Description.Condition: fair; rusty stapling generally; ,4 ront cover marked with pink stain; (.7 ottom corner of front cover torn away,15mm x 15mm; (.8 ater stain at bottom corner of front cove

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet issued by the Bexhill and District Horticultural Society for the Flower Show held at the Polegrove on 5th and 6th August 1936; page 5 is an application form for this show and page 43 is a form for entry in the autumn show in October; the class list and prizes are clearly laid out and interspersed with local trade advertisements; apart from the two presidents, the Mayor of Bexhill and Col.O.Striedinger, there are 27 vice-presidents headed by the Earl De La Warr; the committee chairman is W.J.Bailey Esq., the treasurer, S.G.Marsh of Westminster Bank, and secretary, G.H.Davis of Holliers Hill
Identification.Title: "Schedule of Prizes for the Bexhill-on-Sea Flower Show"

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet of rules of a branch of the Ancient Order of Foresters Friendly Society set up for the benefit of Bexhill; meetings and office were at the Castle Hotel; the branch was registered on 17th February 1891 under the Friendly Societies' Act of 1875; affiliated to the Bexhill District, it was to be known as 'Court De La Warr, No.7422; secretary was Stephen Lennard; the three members listed as signatories were Edward C.Tickner, R.J.Cruttenden and Frederick B.Errey; benefits included life insurance and burial fees for wives, payments during sickness and unemployment, relief to members in distressed circumstances, and help with travel to find employment; sources of the finance needed were from members' contributions, fines for rulebreaking and interest on capital held
Identification.Title: "Rules of Court 'De La Warr' No.7422 Branch of the Brighton District of the Ancient Order of Foresters Friendly Society"

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & fire & service & photo,1892
local history & Bexhill & fire & service & dispute,1892

Identification.BriefDescription: a b/w photograph of the 17 men of Bexhill Fire Brigade c.1892 posing with their horses and carriage outside their station; pasted on to the reverse is a small newspaper cutting quoting an item in the Bexhill Chronicle of 14th October 1892; it tells of a tense moment during a Fire Brigade Competition, taking place on the Tennis Lawn of the Manor House on the previous Wednesday, bringing the event to an end prematurely; the competition had been postponed for two weeks and proved to be the climax of the Brigade's protesting against the appointment of a new Chief Officer; a rumour of a proposed mass resignation after the contest caused Lord Cantelupe to abandon the giving of prizes; after much discussion between the men and Lord Cantelupe the prizes were handed over to the men; they felt that they deserved them after their attendance at drill during the year; the article concluded with comments on the insubordination being 'anything but creditable to the sense of duty and discipline, so long as they were members of the corps'
Identification.Title: "Fire Brigade Crisis"

Description.Aspect: whole : a photograph pasted on to cardboard; a column of newsprint pasted on to reverse; handwritten note on reverse
Description.Condition: fair; edges worn; rust coloured spotting with age on reverse of backing card

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 1989.57.1 history of the Brigade 1888 to 1935 by R.Cecil Sewell
BEXHM : 1996.314.1=2 tickets for the Fire Brigade Competition

Object.Notes: quote from 'Bexhill Observer' 22nd Mar.1969 : 'Crowded Career in the short life of the 8th Earl De La Warr - He was the Honorary Captain of the town's original Volunteer Fire Brigade, and became captain when it was reconstructed in 1892.'

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Fire Brig. & photo,1922

Identification.BriefDescription: a b/w photograph of Bexhill Fire Brigade taken in 1922 outside their station at the bottom of Amherst Road; an attached caption includes the name of R.C.Sewell, chairman, and, on the reverse of this is a note about the appliance '"Diana", converted to motor engine in 1921 and eventually christened by C[oun]t[es]s De La Warr in 1925'; a separate sheet gives the names of the firemen and civilians pictured; the three civilians are Capt. Dunn, C.Sewell, and L.Russell; there is a curious pen and ink sketch on the reverse of the name sheet with a speech bubble 'When can I come to the Art Class at Bexhill Mum?'
Identification.Title: "Bexhill Fire Brigade 1922"

Description.Aspect: whole : a matt black and white photograph; an added tab with typed detail fixed to bottom edge; the reverse appears to have the remains of a paper mount and paste marks; another sheet with handwritten detail on one side and a pen and ink sketch on the reverse
Description.Condition: fair

Identification.BriefDescription: a circular issued c.1895 by Walter Noakes, of Station Road, Bexhill, a candidate in a Bexhill Urban District Council election; the text is addressed 'To the Electors' and is a contradiction by Mr.Noakes of 3 malicious statements made against him which would affect his standing for election; firstly, he had a contract with the Board to supply firemen's boots, to which he replied he 'had never had such a contract!'; secondly, that he had not attended to his duties as Guardian, to which he replied that he had probably visited the Workhouse more often and spent more time with the inmates than any other gentleman on the Board; thirdly, that many votes were given to him by mistake, when voters believed him to be another person, to which he replied that the statement was 'too barefaced to need contradiction'; he ended with the fact that he had 'no Paid Canvassers'

Description.Aspect: a buff coloured sheet pasted on to a white backing whole black printed detail
Description.Condition: good; pinholes at top corners; original marked with age in places

Object.Notes: Mr.W.Noakes is mentioned in the museum records as a candidate in Bexhill Urban District elections in 1895 and 1898; a Mr.Noakes is one of 6 candidates including Earl De La Warr mentioned in a group canvassing circular for 1901; the mention of 'the Board' implies that Mr.Noakes was a member of the Local Board which preceded the Urban District Council, formed in 1894

Identification.BriefDescription: a card issued to canvass votes for six candidates in the forthcoming Bexhill Urban District election of 1901; candidates were Earl De La Warr, Lord Francis Godolphin Osborne, and Messrs Douglas, Gray, Noakes, and Laughton; Polling was to be on Monday 25th March at the Infants' School, Western Road between 8a.m. and 8p.m.; on the reverse is a sample voting form with crosses by the names of the above candidates in bolder print than the rest; above is the name of George Brisley written in ink with his voting number 193 in District D; Mr. Brisley has added in pencil 'Licensee of Queen's Head' beside the name of Mr.Goodwin; (for the names of other candidates please see note below)

Description.Aspect: a card with black printed detail on both sides whole handwritten insertion at top of one side
Description.Condition: good

Object.Notes: other candidates : BUDDEN, Edward John; DIXIE, Arthur Edward; GOODWIN, John Pelling; SMITH, Walter John; YOUNG, Henry

Identification.BriefDescription: a circular letter from James M.Glover refuting allegations made against him as a 'Bogey' by the "Bexhill Chronicle" possibly in 1905; he refers to a Burgess List and the deletion from it of the name of Lord De La Warr; a special court had taken place at the Town Hall on 11th October at which Mr.Glover had seen the original list for the first time; he hoped for the vote of the readers despite the "Bexhill Chronicle" tactics
Identification.Title: "The Horrible Revelations"

Description.Aspect: a single sheet with printed detail on one side only whole pasted to buff card
Description.Condition: fair; pinholes in upper corners for display

Object.Notes: James Glover came from Drury Lane to become manager of the Kursaal in 1900; he was a candidate in the election for the new Bexhill Borough Council in 1902 (see BEXHM : 1996.107)

Identification.BriefDescription: 2 booklets issued by the Bexhill Incorporation Committee in preparation for an official petition to Parliament soon to be circulated for signatures of residents; committee chairman was Earl De La Warr; secretary, Mr. George Vale; names of other committee members are listed including Mr. George Brisley whose pencilled initials are on one of the covers; the text in the booklets is the same despite the different titles, explaining the benefits of a municipal corporation and the reasons for seeking incorporation for a rapidly growing Bexhill
Identification.Title: "A Few Words on the Incorporation of Bexhill"
"Incorporation - What it is and What it Means"

Description.SummaryText: whole : 2 booklets of 1 printed double sheet in grey or pale blue cover
Description.Condition: fair

Identification.BriefDescription: a poster or publicity sheet printed and issued in advance of a meeting to be held the same evening at 8.15p.m. in the York Hall, Bexhill; headed 'De la Warr Protection Society' and announcing the meeting of the Society, the poster is in fact protesting against the society and what will be pronounced at the meeting; the public is advised that they will hear 'Fallacious Statements' and these are listed in a column right centre of the page, while alongside is a column of 'True Statements'; the matter behind the disagreement appears to relate to the taking over of the eastern part of the town by Lord De La Warr

Description.Condition: fair; general soiling on outer sides

Identification.BriefDescription: a printed leaflet dated 3rd October 1934; written by J.S.W., it is an open letter to residents of Bexhill giving his well-reasoned opinion about the Council's Sewerage Scheme, 'fast approaching completion'; he asserts that since 1923 the town has deteriorated due to the Councillors in power; he quotes from the Borough Medical Officer's report for 1933 and gives a clear explanation of what the sewerage scheme consists of; J.S.W. ends with a description of the newly formed Bexhill, Cooden and District Protection Association with their office in Western Road and urges the reader to sign and post the postcard provided by them in protest at the Sewerage Scheme; he claims that Lord De La Warr could do something if he realised the gravity of the situation
Identification.Title: "Bexhill at the Crossroads"

Description.Aspect: whole : a folded sheet with printed detail on all sides
Description.Condition: fair

Identification.BriefDescription: a poster issued in 1971 by Bexhill Borough Council encouraging public response to a referendum on the future of Bexhill in respect of the proposed local government reorganisation; voting papers were available at the Town Hall, the De La Warr Pavilion and community centres; voting took place from 2nd to 18th October 1971

Description.Aspect: a sheet of card printed on one side whole red and blue bold lettering on a white ground
Description.Condition: fair; top edge worn and slightly torn in places; general soiling and creasing

Identification.BriefDescription: from the Parish Magazines of March, April and July 1890 and August 1891 starting with the acceptance of an offer of land from Earl De La Warr to build a new church on the corner of Cantelupe and Sea Roads; Rev.L.S.Clarke, former Rector of Bexhill, had offered £5000 for the construction; architect was Sir Arthur Blomfield; donations towards extra expenses had been received from the Bishop of Chichester (£100) and Mr.S.Scrivens (£250); a bank account had been opened for any other donations; the laying of the foundation stone for the new St.Barnabas Church by Mrs.Clarke is reported in the July 1890 magazine; in the issue of August 1891 it is stated that voluntary contributions amounted to £850

Description.Aspect: whole : 3 sheets with typed detail on one side of each
Description.Condition: good

Object.Notes: part of BEXHM : 1996.379.1=15

Identification.BriefDescription: from the Parish Magazines of July 1888 and July 1889; the first (.14) describes the opening of the new Reading Room or Institute on 21st June 1888 with mention of those on the committee responsible for the project and Earl De La Warr their chairman; Sir Robert Head was the speaker facetiously contrasting the contemporary views about education with those of Jack Cade's day; despite the rain many residents had attended with enthusiastic support and contributions to the committee; (.15) is a report of the well-attended first Annual General Meeting held on 21st June 1889; 160 membership cards had been issued and an Institute Library was to be formed

Description.Aspect: whole : 2 sheets with typed detail on one side only

Identification.BriefDescription: a printed circular giving details of the arrangements made by Lord De La Warr for musical and other entertainments for the 1896 summer season in Bexhill; Herr Wurm's Viennese White band was to play at Whitsuntide and from July to September with another band at other times; an international and national Bicycle meeting was to held from 3rd to 5th August on a new cycle track being made on the sea front; Lord De La Warr's cricket team was to play the Australians from 30th July to 1st August; Lord De La Warr expected to have to pay much of the cost but hoped that residents of Bexhill would contribute in tne efforts to bring prosperity to Bexhill; subscribers of 3, 5, 10 guineas would receive 1,2, or 3 Free Passes; agents for subscription included Mr.G.H.Gray at the Estate Office and Mr.G.Brisley, chemist of Station (London) Road

Description.Aspect: whole : 2 printed sheets joined on reverse with paper strip and folded

H.W.Simpson as paid in November 1865, total £162 19s 101/2d; 1868, total £166 2s 2d; 1869, total £170 7s 11d; 1870, total £171 3s 2d; 1871, total £172 17s 5d; payments due 1st October; Lord De La Warr's portion always £6 9s 9d and 'late Papillon's' £1 15s 0d; A.S.Brook's amount varies and in 1871 he is named as landowner

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & land & DLWarr & dispute,1897

Identification.BriefDescription: a printed 4 page booklet of March 1897 by 'Men of Common Sense' about the loss of a piece of land due to neglect of duty by Bexhill District Council; the pamphlet deals with the exchanges between the council and Earl De La Warr and his trustees over the seafront [please see note below]; the 'triangular plot' was a gift from the De La Warr estate with conditions about its upkeep by the district council; these were largely neglected; various negotiations for the free conveyance to the council of the seafront up to the Coastguard station became drawn out and inconclusive so that the land was eventually offered for sale at £4000; the neglected triangular plot became a cause for complaint and notice was served by Earl De La Warr to the council to give up the ground on 25th December 1895; the writer of the pamphlet ends with the advice that the Council minute books are open for inspection by ratepyers to verify his facts; Mr.Sidney Smith, seconded by Mr.Cooper, was responsible for the ending of negotiations for the free transfer of the seafront by moving on 15th July 1895 that the resolution to accept the Earl's gift should be rescinded by the council
Identification.Title: "The True History of the Triangular Plot"

Description.SummaryText: whole : 4 page booklet of printed detail
Description.Condition: fair
Description.Note: staples missing but pages pasted together; general soiling and rust marks

Object.Notes: the 'triangular plot' was part of the seafront retained by Lord De La Warr when land to the west of Sea Road was transferred in part payment to W.Webb the builder; it is now the eastern end of the De La Warr car park and gardens south of Marina

Identification.BriefDescription: schedule for use at the sale by auction at 6.30p.m. on 3rd March 1905 at the Devonshire Hotel by Messrs.Woodhmas, Son and Parks, with Mr.C.Truscott Beale; lot 1 - land on Bexhill sea front laid out as lawns and promenade from the western boundary of the DLW estate [end of Sea Road] to the end of Devonshire Road; lot 2 - land fronting Hastings Road and proposed tramway for about 160 feet with return frontage of 135 feet to De La Warr Road, total acreage 0r.1r.22p.; if not sold in one lot the land would be offered in three lots; an advantage of the land was that it was the site reserved for licensed premises on the Glyne Estate; refers to an Estate Map not included in this item; a paper strip attached to the front of the schedule states that the sale was to be postponed until 17th March at 6.30p.m.; both sales unless previously sold privately
Identification.Title: "Particulars and Conditions of Sale of Land on the Sea Front and of a Valuable Building Site"

Description.SummaryText: whole: 1 folded sheet with printed detail on three sides stapled into a pink paper cover with printed detail on front; added paper strip printed in red

Identification.BriefDescription: (.1) a printed letter dated 21st February 1887 from Col.Henry Lane to the inhabitants of Bexhill informing those who could not be present of the result of a General Meeting to discuss a local Memorial for the Golden Jubilee of Queen Victoria's reign; it was decided that a Public Reading Room and Library for all classes was needed in Bexhill; subscriptions and patronage should ensure that it would be self-supporting; the erection and furnishing of the building would be the Jubilee Memorial; (.2) a pink printed sheet issued 2nd May 1887 by the Jubilee Committee of Bexhill; the intended Public Reading Room, on land donated by Earl De La Warr (7th), was described, with details of membership subscriptions; £170 had been raised towards a target of £200, when a promised donation of £50 would bring the total needed for the project

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & cycling & hire charges,1898

Identification.BriefDescription: a small folded card with printed information about charges for hiring, storing, cleaning and repairing cycles, instruction and tickets at the De La Warr Cycling Boulevard, Bexhill in 1898; communications were to be addressed to Mr.Percy Young; handwritten inside is the name of A.C.Bunting; cost of a day ticket was 2d; weekly ticket 1s 0d; 8 lessons with loan of cycle, 15s 0d;
Identification.Title: "De La Warr Cycling Boulevard"

Description.Aspect: a small folded card with green printed detail on all sides whole handwritten addition
Description.Condition: fair; soiled

Identification.BriefDescription: 2 booklets issued by the Bexhill Horticultural Society for the Flower Shows in 1958 and 1959; in each year the Summer shows were held in August at the Polegrove, Bexhill; the Spring, and Early and Late Autumn shows were held at the De La Warr Pavilion in April, September and October; the booklet includes class and prize money lists, application forms for competition entry, show rules, a report from the chairman and local trade advertisements; in 1959 it was decided in committee to discontinue the Spring show and Mr.Hyland was handing over the chairmanship to Mr.Eardley
Identification.Title: "Flower Shows"

Description.Aspect: whole : 2 booklets of 32 printed pages each in paper covers; (.5) cover green printed on white with a pink and brown floral illustration; (.6) cover black printed on yellow ground featuring coat of arms; stapled
Description.Condition: fair; rusting staples

Object.Notes: a brief note from the donor is left with the booklets

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Coronation & programme & souvenir,1937

Identification.BriefDescription: a programme of celebrations published by the Borough of Bexhill for the Coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth on 12th May 1937; includes detail about royal visits to Bexhill and the local area; events from 5th to 17th May 1937 ending with the Horse Show and a Carnival dance at the De La Warr Pavilion

Description.SummaryText: whole : a booklet with white rough paper cover designed in navy blue and red and slightly larger than the 8 inside pages
Description.Condition: fair
Description.Note: cover soiled; centre pages loose

Event.EventName: Coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth

Object.Notes: S1/Entertainments Box

Identification.BriefDescription: a programme for a concert played by the De La Warr Orchestra on 14th August (c.1900) at 11 a.m. at the Kursaal, Bexhill-on-Sea; J.M.Glover was Director of Entertainments and Conductor; booklet includes details of forthcoming entertainment including Passion Play pictures at 9.30 on Sunday, Mrs.Kendal at the Kursaal, Van Biene at the Kursaal, and Ben Greet's Players in 'Midsummer Night's Dream', 'Twelfth Night' and 'As You Like It'; information for visitors and local trade advertisements fill the remaining pages
Identification.Title: "The Kursaal"

Description.Aspect: 8 pages in red and green printed cover whole centre pages have red decorative border
Description.Condition: fair; cover and some pages discoloured

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 1996.392.1; 1996.531; 2000,64.1; 2000.65.4 other Kursaal programmes very similar in design

Object.Notes: year date - the showing of pictures of the (Oberammergau) Passion Play implies a date in or after 1901; the play takes place in the first year of each decade; also, 'Interesting Mems for Bexhill Visitors' reveals that Bexhill was then governed by an Urban District Council, which gave way to the Borough Council at the end of 1902

Identification.BriefDescription: 2 pages from 'Illustrated Bits' magazine, c.1903; (.1) is a series of sketches of moments in Bexhill experienced by the artist Frank Chesworth and his companion L.Godfrey-Taylor; (.2) is a tongue-in-cheek account by Mr.Godfrey-Taylor of their visit to Bexhill supposedly to see a particular actress in a London play revived at the Kursaal theatre; unmalicious in tone, the author desribes the clientele of the Kursaal and the aims of Lord De La Warr and Mr.Glover in attracting the more refined visitor to the delights of Bexhill-on-Sea (te below for further information)
Identification.Title: "Illustrated Bits - The Call Boy - The Cure-us-all; or On the De La Warr Path"

Description.Aspect: whole : 2 pages torn from a publication
Description.Condition: poor; discoloured; one centre fold almost torn across

Object.Notes: the dress appears more Edwardian than Victorian hence a date of post 1901; also, from BEXHM : 1995.121 dated 8 Feb.1908 a mention of "Mr.and Mrs.Arthur Bourchier (Miss Violet Vanbrugh) resuming those visits which proved so popular in 1903"; quote from the article - 'His (J.Glover's) gods at Bexhill-on-Sea are little tin gods and their wives or their daughters or their sisters, as the case may be, are little tin goddesses, and he plays up to them "according", giving them Dvorak, Liszt, Weber, Wagner, and armchairs with cushions in them; and promising such further Society luxuries (for August) as Mr.George Grossmith, Mr.Arthur Bourchier and Miss Violet Vanbrugh, Mr.Albert Chevalier, Mrs.Kendal, Mr.N.Vert's Concert party, ....'

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Penguin Players & prog.,1967

Identification.BriefDescription: a programme for a performance of 'The Boy Friend' by The Penguin Players at the De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill from Monday 10th to Tuesday 18th July 1967; produced by Richard Burnett; Bexhill Manager of Entertainments was Rupert A. Lockwood

Description.Aspect: a folded sheet with design on dark red background on one side whole red and black printed detail on other sides
Description.Condition: fair; creased

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 1992.280.112 similar programme in BEXHM : 1992.280, a series of 123 programmes

Classification.Keyword: local history & De La Warr & welcome & menu,1900

Identification.BriefDescription: (.1) a menu and toast list for the banquet at the Hotel Metropole, Bexhill on 26th July 1900 to welcome home the Earl De La Warr after the South African Campaign; some added handwritten notes in pencil; includes names of those speaking for the toasts; (.2) a bank balance statement showing the amount owing to Lloyds Bank after expenses from the De La Warr Reception Fund; figures verified by Frank Williams and J.H.Lightbody from detail available on application at the bank

Description.Aspect: ornately printed folded card whole contains bank balance record

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & DLWP & pool & corresp.,1935

Identification.BriefDescription: a series of letters and other material revealing the story behind the abandoning of plans to construct a swimming pool in front of the De La Warr Pavilion in 1935; includes a ledger, the remaining pages of which show the accounts for the club from 1933 to 1935; for more detail please see following records

Description.Aspect: whole : 1 hard backed ledger type book with red cover, several central pages cut away along central stitching; a variety of material on sheets of varying sizes, some typed, some handwritten, some with printed headings; extracts from publications enclosed in a folded sheet
Description.Condition: fair

Event.EventName: proposed swimming pool in front of De La Warr Pavilion

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 2001.6.34 an issue of the 'Bexhill Independent' for July 1935 including articles and comment about the proposed pool [in S1/DLWP Box 2]

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & DLWP & pool & cutting,1935

Identification.BriefDescription: a newspaper cutting from The Sussex Daily News [please see note below] featuring a photograph taken looking down towards the Colonnade, the site of the proposed swimming pool in front of the De La Warr Pavilion; the text under the headlines "Bexhill's Luxury Bathing Pool - Details of the Scheme - Capacity for 500 People" reports on a meeting of Bexhill Town Council; the Deputy Mayor described the development as 'not merely a bathing pool. The scheme was directly related to the Entertainment Hall, and consisted of a connecting pergola on the east, a swimming pool on the site of the existing Colonnade, stairs and gardens ... public lavatories and first-aid station, all combined in one architectural unity'; the pool would be 80 feet in diameter; the deep end 12 feet and the shallow end 2 feet 6 inches; deep water for polo would be 60 feet by 30 feet; full capacity of the bath would be for 500 bathers; there would be room for 200 people in the gallery of the swimming pool and the complete upper level would provide for 500 more spectators; there would be 50 changing cabins and 332 lockers; quoted superficial areas were, for Egerton Park baths 3,330 sq.ft.; for new baths 5,024sq.ft.
Identification.CollectionName: ex Bexhill Amateur Swimming Association Archive

Description.Aspect: whole : a newspaper cutting featuring a picture with a column of newsprint below
Description.Condition: fair; rust marks from paper clip at one top corner

Event.EventName: proposed new swimming pool in front of DLWP

Object.Notes: name of newspaper gleaned from beginning of report about greyhound racing on reverse; photocopy placed in De La Warr Pavilion file

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & swimming & pool & report,1935

Identification.BriefDescription: an architect's general report dated 25th October 1935 on the proposed swimming pool in front of the De La Warr Pavilion at Bexhill; typed detail on four pages covers the analysis of Schemes A, B and C, giving measurements, A.S.A. standards and costings; Scheme A was the current design, Scheme B, an alternative larger pool design, and Scheme C, was for the development of the site without the proposed pool
Identification.CollectionName: ex Bexhill Amateur Swimming Club Archive

Description.Aspect: whole : 4 sheets with typed detail on one side of each
Description.Condition: fair; rust spots generally, especially on last sheet, and from straight pin in top corners of each sheet; discoloured at bottom corner of first sheet

Event.EventName: proposed new swimming pool in front of DLWP

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & swimming & pool & report,1935

Identification.BriefDescription: a typed, neat, but amended, draft of the official protest of Bexhill Amateur Swimming Club and the Amateur Swimming Association against the proposed swimming pool to be built by Bexhill Town Council in front of the De La Warr Pavilion as part of the complex centred on the De La Warr Pavilion, opened in 1935; Mr.Elliott as secretary of the Bexhill A.S.C. explained that the protest was based on facts available to the club, because there had been no opportunity for 'thorough scrutiny of the detailed drawings'; references of note are to heated water in an open air pool; the need for A.S.A. standards if spectator revenue is expected; the efforts in past years to have the old pool covered over for winter swimming; to the remarks by the mayor of 1934, in favour of a covered pool in Bexhill; and, to the quoted view of the national governing body of swimming, the Amateur Swimming Association
Identification.CollectionName: ex Bexhill Amateur Swimming Club Archive

Description.Aspect: whole : 4 thin sheets with typed detail on one side of each
Description.Condition: fair; some wear at edges

Event.EventName: proposed new swimming pool in front of DLWP

Identification.BriefDescription: an issue of 'Bexhill Independent' for July 1935; includes many local trade and other advertisements; articles on local issues the majority commenting on the proposed swimming pool in front of the De La Warr Pavilion then being constructed
Identification.CollectionName: ex Bexhill Amateur Swimming Club Archive
Identification.Title: "Bexhill Independent Vol.2 No.7"

Description.Condition: fair

Object.Notes: part of BEXHM : 2001.6 from Bexhill Swimming Club Archive

Identification.BriefDescription: an album of items collected during the first year of the De La Warr Pavilion's opening; items are carefully pasted to lined pages from an exercise book with two holes punched at one side of each for filing; included in the first pages are the message from the 9th Earl De La Warr at the stone-laying ceremony on 6th May 1935, information about the architects Chermayeff and Mendelsohn, policy statements and photographs and details about leading personalities involved; G.B.Shaw's postcard is reproduced with his photograph; the events covered are dated to 25th April (p.47); the remainder are assumed to have taken place into the summer of 1936; the final programme detail and cuttings refer to the B.A.T.S.' production of 'Princess Ida'; (.2) a postcard advertising 'Love Laughs' (p.43 in album); (.3) a photograph postcard of a scene from 'Road House' by B.A.T.S. (p.47 in album)

Description.Aspect: whole : a handmade cardboard file with lacing and reinforced holes; 77 sheets of exercise book paper; programmes and newspaper cuttings are pasted to all but the last few pages
Description.Condition: poor; 37 pages from the start are now loose with filing holes torn; lace loosened to enable reading of other pages; exercise book paper very discoloured and frayed at edges; most of the pasted-in items are in reasonably good condition apart from the rust-spotted one inside the front cover; cover originally bluish green now very discoloured and soiled on front; spine is splitting; sepia picture pasted to front is torn and scratched in places; 2 small blots to one side of front picture

Object.Notes: no detail of the creator of the album is available

Identification.BriefDescription: items relating to the Special Council Meeting on 12th February 1958 at 3pm organised to award the Freedom of the Borough of Bexhill to Miss Frances Henrietta Burrows; (.1) an invitation card to Mr. H.J.Sargent; (.2) a blue entrance ticket for seat E13; (.3) a covering letter for the ticket; (.4) programme booklet including related biographical detail and a b/w photograph of Miss Burrows standing by a window

Description.SummaryText: whole : 1 white printed card; i smaller bliue printed card; 1 sheet of headed notepaper with typed detail; 1 booklet woth cream card cover and 2 pages
Description.Condition: fair

Object.Notes: from the biographical detail : Miss Frances Burrows had been a Bexhill Borough Councillor from 1930 to 1937, and an Alderman from 1937 to 1940; she had founded Ancaster House Girls' School in Bexhill which was then evacuated, ending her council membership in 1940; she had been involved with the WVS and Girl Guiding, serving education generally including for ESCC, and given valuable service to Bexhill over many years; Ancaster House School had recently celebrated its Golden Jubilee

Identification.BriefDescription: 4 booklets and 1 leaflet relating to events in Bexhill in 1952 and 1953; (.7) a handbook for the Civic Jubilee Exhibition at the De La Warr Pavilion from 10th to 15th November 1952 for the anniversary of the Charter of Incorporation in 1902; text in sections giving information on the various aspects of life in the town, from the Prologue on behalf of Bexhill Museum Association to Bexhill Trades Council and Borough Council departments; includes an index of exhibitors on last page; (.8) a one fold programme issued by the De La Warr Pavilion for the Final Week of the Charter Jubilee Celebrations from 10th to 16th November 1952; includes one act plays by drama groups, entertainments and displays by schools and youth organisations, a civic ball, a pageant, an exhibition and a final performance of Mendelssohn's 'Elijah' by a local chorus of 200 voices and the Kalmar Orchestra, conducted by Colin Davis; (.9) programme number 3738 for Bexhill Carnival on 5th and 6th September 1952 organised and sponsored by Bexhill Round Table; trade advertisements in black and white; (.10) a souvenir programme for Bexhill Coronation Carnival on 6th June 1953, organised and sponsored by Bexhill Round Table; includes trade advertisements

Description.SummaryText: whole : 3 booklets and 1 folded sheet; different designs on covers; leaflet and one booklet printed in red and blue; some black and white illustrations with text in one booklet
Description.Condition: fair

Object.Notes: (municipal box 8?)

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & actvities & promotion & month,1963

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet with centre pages 9 to 20 missing issued to accompany a Community Activity Month at the De La Warr Pavilion in May 1963; messages from Lord Rupert Nevill, who opened the exhibition on 20th May, and the Mayor of Bexhill, Mrs. Joyce Alexander, stress the importance of voluntary service and activity to the community of Bexhill; most of the booklet features contributions from each of the exhibiting societies explaining their history and aims; details are given of performances by Bexhill Amateur Theatrical Society, Little Common Drama Group, Bexhill Players, Bexhill Light Opera and Dramatic Society and Bexhill Choral Union and Citizens Orchestra
Identification.Title: "Community Activity Month - De La Warr Pavilion May 1963"

Description.SummaryText: whole : 6 pages in a card cover; cover design printed in blue and brown
Description.Condition: fair

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Reginald Road & deed,1901

Identification.BriefDescription: a typed copy of an abstract of title giving detail of ownership of about 14 acres of land in Bexhill including the Crickety(ing) Field and sold by trustees, J.A.M.Cope and A.Buckley, at the request of 7th Earl De La Warr to William Henry Goodwin on 30th December 1882 for £2000 with a mortgage; plan mentioned but not included; further details tell of death in October 1887 of W.H.Goodwin and the replacement of his trustees, Emily Cross, niece, and Frederick Goodwin, son, by W.G.Carpenter, Gentleman of Hastings, and Ralph Hale Gaby, solicitor; it was agreed that the latter should be allowed to take charges for his work relating to the estate
Identification.Title: "Abstract of Title to an estate near Bexhill Station Sussex"

Description.Aspect: whole : 11 typed pages and one blank with title on reverse attached with paper fastener
Description.Condition: fair; first page torn downwards from centre top to first fold; some other small tears at edges; soiled on outer folds

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Reginald Road & deed,1897

Identification.BriefDescription: an indenture dated 30th April 1897 recording the selling of four plots of land on the east side of Reginald Road, Bexhill, nos 253 to 256 incl., to William and Aubrey Tanner, Carpenters of Bexhill; vendors, W.G.Carpenter and R.H.Gaby, were replacement trustees of William H.Goodwin who bought the land from the De La Warr estate in 1882 and died in 1887; they were acting with Henry Noakes, builder of Eastbourne; to trustees, £220 and H.Noakes, £50, total cost £270; includes plan and pencilled note about the repayment of £150 and one house released

Description.Aspect: a folded handwritten legal document on strong paper with printed heading and red borders to three sides whole title and plan on fourth side

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Halle Orch & programme,1963

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet giving details of various activities making up a Festival of Music organised by Bexhill Corporation in 1963; Festival Administrator was Rupert Lockwood; from Wednesday 26th to Saturday 29th June the programme included a civic procession and church service on the first day, with daily wine and cheese tasting, afternoon coach tours, pre-concert dinners, an evening concert by the Halle Orchestra conducted by John Barbarolli, and dancing after the concert; the booklet includes written pieces about Sir John B., performers Beryl Grey, Marion Davies and Ian Lake, and Nigel Abercrombie, Secretary General of the Arts Council; notes on the music played; a film about Glyndebourne was to be shown on Friday; also further interesting detail; inserted is an unused booking form
Identification.Title: "4th Annual Festival of Music"

Identification.BriefDescription: a typed list of the schedule for those taking part in the opening on 10th November 1952 of the exhibition for the Bexhill Charter Jubilee, held at the De La Warr Pavilion; the time covered was from 6.45p.m. to 7.20p.m. and covered the Mayor's welcoming Alderman Ashby, who was to perform the opening ceremony, and presenting him with a gift on the occasion of his fiftieth wedding anniversary, the opening of the exhibition and reply to the Lord Mayor, the Lord Mayor's thanks to Alderman Ashby followed by a tour around the exhibition, the sending of a telegram from the Post Office stand and the turning on of a 'dripping tap' at the Water Department stand

Identification.BriefDescription: several papers issued by Bexhill Corporation for the Special Council Meeting held on 2nd April 1952, a part of the Charter Jubilee Celebrations; entitled "Notes for the Guidance of Official Guests, each set of instructions, on a single, two, or three sheets, is for a lettered group from A to F; Group A - Mayors and Town Clerks; Group B - Mayoresses; Group C - Guests of the Corporation; Group D [2 copies] - Members of the Council; Group E - Officials of the Corporation; Group F - The Freemen; the range of subjects covered consists of car parking, time of arrival, transport from the Sackville Hotel to the De La Warr Pavilion; the procession into the Chamber; leaving the Chamber, the taking of photographs and transport to aperitifs and lunch at the Sackville Hotel for those with tickets for the Luncheon; an indication of the visiting guests is seen by the origin of the macebearers present, Bexhill, Chichester, Lewes, Arundel, Rye, Hastings, Brighton, Eastbourne, Worthing and Hove; the new Freemen appear to have been Alderman Bowrey, Mrs.Meads and Mr.Sewell, to each of which a casket and a scroll were presented
Identification.Title: "Notes for the Guidance of Official Guests"

Identification.BriefDescription: a booklet giving the Order of Proceedings for the Special Council meeting held on 2nd April 1952 at the De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill-on-Sea as part of the Charter Jubilee celebrations; included in the booklet are lists of council members in 1902 and for 1951 to 1952, of Mayors of the borough from 1902 to 1952, and of Honorary Freemen; part of the Special Meeting was the presentation of the Freedom of the Borough to Mrs.C.I.Meads, Mr.E.W.C.Bowrey and Mr.R.C.Sewell, whose portrait photographs are featured in the booklet; guests of honour were the Lord Lieutenant of Sussex and his wife, the Duke and Duchess of Norfolk; the Mayor at the time was Mr.G.H.Goodwin; other contents are details of the agenda and of the order of arrival and departure of guests, and an introduction dealing with the Charter of 1902 and the town's development
Identification.Title: "Charter Jubilee Celebrations"

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Lord De La Warr & poster,1896

Identification.BriefDescription: a printed notice dated 15th June 1896 announcing a public meeting that evening at the Devonshire Hotel to organise a Committee from Bexhill residents interested in protesting against a proposal to the Council by Councillor Cooper; the motion, if passed, would betray a pledge by the Council to Lord De La Warr that he might maintain privately the eastern portion of the sea front and nearby roads to the standard required by the Council, including the erection of gates at the entrance to the Parade; the notice was printed at the Bexhill Chronicle office, where a special edition was to be produced the following day giving the result of the council meeting; the 'Council's Pledge' to Lord De La Warr and 'Mr.Cooper's Proposed Motion' are quoted alonside each other, the former in bold print; Lord De La Warr had already 'spent thousands of pounds' and was prepared to 'fight to the bitter end'; these quoted words suggest that the Earl and his supporters were instrumental in the production of the notice and the organisation of the public meeting

Description.Aspect: a sheet of paper pasted on a sheet of light card of similar size whole details in bold and light print
Description.Condition: fair; creased horizontally

Classification.Keyword: local history & Bexhill & Town Hall & opening,1895

Description.Aspect: whole : a card with printed detail on one side only; small photo attached with coloured coats of arms at each side; handwritten insertion into the printed detail
Description.Condition: fair; 1 bottom corner missing; general discoloration; 2 small rust holes at bottom side edge from straight pin insertion at some time

RelatedObject.ObjectIdentity: BEXHM : 2004.144.20.2 Official Programme

Identification.BriefDescription: an official programme giving details of the celebrations in Bexhill for the Coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth in 1937; includes photographs; beginning with Divine Service at St.Peter's Church at 11.15a.m. on 9th May, the celebrations included a relay from the De La Warr Pavilion of the broadcast of the Coronaton ceremony on 12th May, the Royal Salute being fired from the old Pavilion site at the foot of Sea Road at 12 noon; at 10.30 on Thursday and Friday, 13th and 14th May, a film of the Coronation ceremony was to be shown at the Playhouse, Western Road; on Saturday 15th there were to be bowls competitions and a sports meeting, a Fanciers' show for poultry, pigeons, rabbits and children's pets, and variety entertainment by Bexhill Amateur Theatrical Society (B.A.T.S.); on Monday 17th at the Polegrove the Bexhill Horse Show was to take place and an Interclub Regatta had been arranged by Bexhill Rowing Club; a Carnival Dance was to follow at 8.30p.m. at the De La Warr Pavilion; the brochure features several photographs, including portaits of the king and queen, and images of their two visits to Bexhill in the past, with accompanying commentary; a visit by Queen Mary in 1935 is also described; the mayor of Bexhill was W.N.Cuthbert and the Town Clerk, S.J.Taylor
Identification.Part: (.24a) a single page leaflet issued by Bexhill Hotels association giving the advantages of taking holidays over the Coronation period in Bexhill
Identification.Title: "Bexhill-on-Sea Coronation 1937 Souvenir Programme"

Description.Aspect: whole : 8 printed pages in a slightly larger, stiff paper cover; design on front; includes several printed photographs; each page has red, white and blue lined border around text
Description.Condition: fair; soiled on cover

Event.EventName: Coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth

Identification.BriefDescription: 4 brochures numbered 421, 423, 426 and 430, giving details of a 1960 Community Activity Exhibition and associated entertainment which took place at the De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill on 5th, 6th and 7th October 1960 celebrating the building's Silver Jubilee; the centre pages are taken up with a plan of the hall showing sites of stalls and exhibitors; individual paragraphs give the aims and objectives of exhibitors from page 4 onwards; entertainment ranged from P.T. displays to choral and orchestral concerts and a performance of Gilbert and Sullivan's 'Trial by Jury'; included in the brochure are messages from A.E.Gardner, Chairman of the Organising Committee, and R.F.Botting, Mayor of Bexhill; background on front cover is an aerial photograph of the Colonnade and the surrounding area; editor of the brochure was E.J.Burnam
Identification.Title: "Community Activity Exhibition"

Description.Aspect: whole : 8 pages in a card cover; printed detail on all sides; front has dark blue printed title on a white and light blue photographic background in a silver border; each booklet is individually numbered
Description.Condition: fair

Event.EventName: De La Warr Pavilion Silver Jubilee

Identification.BriefDescription: the title page and back page of the publication 'Vanity Fair' issued 23rd September 1896 (Vol.LVI no.1447); the last side features a full page advertisement for Bexhill as a holiday place, with photographs of The Parade, Lord De La Warr's cricket field, the Manor House and the Parish Church; 'splendid hotels with moderate tariffs' are the Sackville and Marine Hotels; fast train times from Victoria and from London Bridge (L.B. and S.C.R.) to Bexhill are noted; boating, fishing, cricket and lawn tennis, Herr Wurm's Viennese band, a cycling tournament and a cricket match between the Australians and Lord De La Warr's Eleven are the main attractions; there was an 18 hole golf links and the 'splendid' Kursaal was open; with 'bracing and invigorating air' and 'charming walks and drives' Bexhill was 'the most delightful spot on the South Coast, within two hours of London'; on the title page are other advertisements including one for the Adelphi Hotel Liverpool; inside are business notices
Identification.Title: "Vanity Fair"

Description.Aspect: whole : a folded sheet with b/w printed detail, including photographs; staple marks at folds indicate other missing pages were enclosed; first side gives title and date of publication; last page gives details of publisher
Description.Condition: poor; centre horizontal fold split for 140mm on second page and 20mm on first; soiled in a band of about 40mm along the same fold on the last side

Identification.BriefDescription: a souvenir brochure published for an Arts Festival for Bexhill's 2000th Charter Celebrations in 1972; Arts Festival administrator was Rupert A.Lockwood, Manager of Entertainments for Bexhill B.C.; performances and events at the De La Warr Pavilion took place from Thursday 25th May to Tuesday 30th May and included concerts by the Halle Orchestra conducted by James Loughran, performances of 'The Hollow Crown' by the Penguin Players directed by Richard Burnett and including Roy Plomley, a recital by pianist Peter Katin of works by Chopin, and a concert by Edmundo Ross and his Orchestra; afternoon tours and pre-concert dinners were also scheduled, with dancing later in the evening after the concerts; financial assistance was given by Bexhill Borough Council and the Arts Council of Great Britain; with the brochure is a leaflet (.36.1) giving information about the festival, booking, accommodation etc.

Identification.BriefDescription: a programme for Bexhill Gala Week from 22nd July to 28th July 1934; organised by various Bexhill clubs and societies with Earl De La Warr as president and Councillor E.J.Bowles as secretary; each page has details of a day's events between advertisements for local businesses; events were very varied and included a children's procession with a boy mayor and corporation, an errand boys' Derby, a gala performance at the Colonnade and a giant bonfire all on 23rd July; on Tuesday there was a bathing costume fashion parade and a human game of draughts; a giant carnival procession took place on Thursday; the week ended with 'Beating the Retreat' at 8p.m., 'Dancing' at 9p.m. and 'Fireworks' at 10.30p.m. until 'Lights Out' at 11.30p.m.; the front cover has an interesting contemporary design
Identification.Title: "Bexhill Gala Week"

Identification.BriefDescription: 3 similar booklets giving advance details of events and performances at the newly opening De La Warr Pavilion, Bexhill from 12th December 1935; included are reproduced photographs with texts of the Mayor and Mayoress; Alderman and Mrs.O Striedinger; the 9th Earl De La Warr; DLWP architects Erich Mendelssohn and Serge Chermayeff; the steel basic structure and the almost finished DLWP; conductors Adrian Boult and Julian Clifford; playwright George Bernard Shaw and an envelope addressed by him; scenes from performances of 'Viceroy Sarah'; Thea Holme of the Oxford Repertory Co.; the inside of the theatre; Matthew Forsyth and another gentleman; advertisements for businesses linked with the De La Warr Pavilion are featured; items to be performed at the inaugural concert are listed; future performers included Kreisler and Dame Sybil Thorndyke

Identification.BriefDescription: a programme for a Boxing Tournament at 8p.m. at the De La Warr Pavilion on 12th April 1937 organised by Bexhill Amateur Athletic Club in aid of their building fund; names of officials and contestants are given; most of the 3 round bouts were between men from Bexhill and Hastings; there were three special 6 round bouts; on the back of the programme are details of the Bexhill AAC, with their HQ in the Gymnasium, Amherst Road, and a note of the new HQ to be built on Little Common Road, The Down; amount already raised was £1,250; donations would be received by The Mayor at the Town Hall, or R.H.Burstow and A.E.Butler at 43 Station Road; Bexhill Entertainments Manager was Edmund Rhodes

Identification.BriefDescription: a souvenir programme issued for the 21st production of The Penguin Players at the De La Warr Pavilion in Bexhill in the week from 7th October 1952; the play was 'Lady Windermere's Fan' produced by Richard Burnett; the programme includes a message from the mayor of Bexhill, Mr. Gilbert H.Goodwin and a brief history by Richard Burnett of the Penguin Players time in Bexhill as a repertory company; of interest is a piece by Richard Burnett and Kathleen Willis about a new play already performed in Yorkshire and other repertory theatres in the north; written by Miss Lynne Reid-Banks, a young member of their company of Penguin Players in Keighley, it was called 'It Never Rains' and was to be performed the week following, from 14th October; it was hoped that managers and critics from London would see it in Bexhill

Identification.BriefDescription: an official programme giving details of the celebrations in Bexhill for the Coronation of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth in 1937; includes photographs; beginning with Divine Service at St.Peter's Church at 11.15a.m. on 9th May, the celebrations included a relay from the De La Warr Pavilion of the broadcast of the Coronaton ceremony on 12th May, the Royal Salute being fired from the old Pavilion site at the foot of Sea Road at 12 noon; at 10.30 on Thursday and Friday, 13th and 14th May, a film of the Coronation ceremony was to be shown at the Playhouse, Western Road; on Saturday 15th there were to be bowls competitions and a sports meeting, a Fanciers' show for poultry, pigeons, rabbits and children's pets, and variety entertainment by Bexhill Amateur Theatrical Society (B.A.T.S.); on Monday 17th at the Polegrove the Bexhill Horse Show was to take place and an Interclub Regatta had been arranged by Bexhill Rowing Club; a Carnival Dance was to follow at 8.30p.m. at the De La Warr Pavilion; the brochure features several photographs, including portaits of the king and queen, and images of their two visits to Bexhill in the past, with accompanying commentary; a visit by Queen Mary in 1935 is also described; the mayor of Bexhill was W.N.Cuthbert and the Town Clerk, S.J.Taylor

Description.Aspect: whole : 8 printed pages in a slightly larger, stiff paper cover; design on front; includes several printed photographs; each page has red, white and blue lined border around text
Description.Condition: fair; soiled cover; staples rusted and centre pages loose

Identification.BriefDescription: a photocopied version of a study of the De La Warr Pavilion produced in 1962 as part of a long term project for the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research; previous studies had taken place in the London area while buildings by the sea were next to be considered in terms of their long-term durability; the study is comprehensive, covering the history of the construction and use of the DLWP, before assessing its condition in words, plans and photographs; mention is made of lack of maintenance and military use during WWII; the last four A3 sheets are a report on the building by the same observers in 1964 after £20,000 work had been done; this study can be compared with the report by Mr.Johannes Schreiner in 1945 (please see below for record no.)
Identification.Title: "Long Term Durability of Buildings - XIV The De la Warr Pavilion Bexhill-on-Sea"

Description.Aspect: whole : 53 x A4 photocopied sheets with typed text on one side only; 14 x A4 sheets with reproduced photographs and plans on one side only; 4 x A3 sheets with text typed in vertical two thirds of one side of each; all fitted into a black plastic spine cover, the A3 sheets folded in to make last pages

Identification.BriefDescription: a document dated 21st January 1908 reciting the transfer of the Kursaal, Bexhill from Earl De La Warr to Walter Claude Johnson; detail includes recital of the original sale of the property and land on 7 March 1906 by the vendors E.D.H.Buckley, Countess De La Warr and W.W.S.Follett to Earl De La Warr for the proposed formation of a company; no company having been formed,the purchaser, Walter Claude Johnson, then undertook to continue the business of the Kursaal as it would be carried on for the Earl De La Warr; £700 was paid by Mr.Johnson to Lady Hilda De La Warr in respect of her £1,500 contributed; the Earl would give up any claims and would insure his life for the benefit of the purchaser in respect of the £5,000 mortgage already in place, the life premium payments shared; Mr.Johnson had written cheques for the payment of £1000 yearly over four years to Herr Stanislaus Wurm, contracted bandmaster; he would alsio pay the £1000 due to Herr Wurm on 31st August 1908; signed by Earl De La Warr and Hilda De La Warr
Identification.Title: "An Agreement as to the Kursaal, Bexhill-on-Sea, Sussex and other matters"
